titlestmt.sponsor: This collection-level EAD record is a product of the Philadelphia Area Consortium of Special Collections Libraries (PACSCL) Consortial Survey Initiative, which was funded by the Andrew W. Mellon Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: Machine-readable finding aid generated in EAD from data in the PACSCL Consortial Survey Database on 12/21/2012. Modified by Dot Porter in 2017.

bioghist.p: Margaret Huyler Goodbody was a 1939 graduate of Bryn Mawr College. Her parents were the Reverend and Mrs. Peter E. Huyler of Honolulu, Hawaii. Goodbody majored in geology. She wrote weekly letters home to her parents describing her studies and college life in detail.

scopecontent.p: This collection consists of correspondence, class notes, and memorabilia of Margaret Huyler Goodbody. The correspondence describes her social life, classes, professors, dormitory life, and other topics. Also included in the collection are various college memorabilia and Goodbody's class notes from geology, art history, and modern drama courses. College memorabilia includes copies of the College News, a 1939 songbook, newspaper clippings, and a humorous sketch about trilobites.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.

otherfindaid.p: A paper finding aid is available in the repository.
